text: {{Infobox settlement | name = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | settlement_type = Region | image_skyline = Cordillera Blanca y Cordillera Negra.jpg | image_alt = | image_caption = Cordillera Blanca and Cordillera Negra in the Ancash Region | image_flag = Bandera Ancash.svg | flag_alt = | image_seal = | seal_alt = | image_shield = | shield_alt = | nickname = | motto = | image_map = Peru - Ancash Department (locator map).svg | map_alt = | map_caption = | pushpin_map = | pushpin_label_position = | pushpin_map_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = | coordinates = | coor_pinpoint = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Peru | subdivision_type1 = Subdivisions | subdivision_name1 = 20 provinces and 166 districts | subdivision_type2 = | subdivision_name2 = | subdivision_type3 = Largest city | subdivision_name3 = Chimbote | established_title = | established_date = | founder = | seat_type = Capital | seat = Huaraz | government_footnotes = | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = Juan Carlos Morillo Ulloa (2019–2022) | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 35914.41 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | area_water_percent = | area_note = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 3052 | elevation_max_m = 6768 | elevation_min_m = 0 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 1083519 | population_as_of = 2017 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | population_note = | timezone1 = | utc_offset1 = | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | postal_code_type = UBIGEO | postal_code = 02 | area_code_type = Dialing code | area_code = 043 | iso_code = PE-ANC | website = www.regionancash.gob.pe | footnotes = | blank_name_sec1 = Principal resources | blank_info_sec1 = | blank2_name_sec1 = Poverty rate | blank2_info_sec1 = 42.6% | blank3_name_sec1 = Percentage of Peru's GDP | blank3_info_sec1 = 2.76% }} Ancash (; ; ) is a Peruvian region north of Lima. It borders the Pacific Ocean. Huaraz, its capital city and transportation hub, sits in the Callejón de Huaylas, a valley between Ancash's two mountain ranges. Cordillera Blanca, the range to the valley's east, has snow-capped peaks rising over 6,000 meters. Encompassing much of Cordillera Blanca is Huarascán National Park, home to Andean condors and jaguars. ==Other websites==
title: Ancash Region
